I was in Adiyaman and Şanlıurfa yesterday and the day before. As president, I have had the pleasure of visiting these things for the first time.
I appreciate the interest and love of our people on both sides.
Balıklı Lake and Hz. I visited the place where the Prophet Abraham was born and I fed the fish. http://t.co/6e7pımkz
Another square from the place where Balıklı Lake is located ... http://t.co/larra3AN
In the near future, there were wonderful mosaics from the Romans in Halepli Bahçe and gave Urfa a different attraction. http://t.co/crlwl5lp
The mosaics, which have been under the ground for two thousand years, are being brought to the surface of the day and this will be a great museum of open air. http://t.co/ttgnsecf
The remains of Göbeklitepe, which is 10 km away from Urfa, which was revealed in recent years, are also important. http://t.co/w4mazqız
Göbeklitepe is the first known trace of humanity on earth and goes to 12,000 years ago. http://t.co/whoz4uml
This is the first reference in the history of archeology. The excavations are continuing. It will be the world's most important cultural treasure in the future.
Excavations were conducted by the German Archaeologist Dr. Klaus Schmidt and the Turkish team are working together. http://t.co/mftvuı5v
We walked out to Göbeklitepe and got off. http://t.co/yzqvgzqs
It would not have happened before joining the ritual when he went to Urfa. One part of the hotel we stayed in was a cave and we had a nice evening. http://t.co/qk9xbdfp
The raw meatballs were kneaded while the turkey was spoken. The son of the young Faruk Bayrak, who lives in his hometown, Pasha and I are his kirvesiydi. http://t.co/96yfgi6z
GAP, dams, irrigation channels have changed not only the Harran Ovas but the entire region in an incredible way.
It is also Turkey's largest energy source. Thank you very much for everyone who has been through the work since the beginning.
Atatürk Dam, the 5th largest dam in the world and the 3rd largest lake in Turkey. http://t.co/2styofot
The water taken from the pump station, which appears below, is being transported through the 26 km underground tunnels. http://t.co/p8jt6zn2
The length of the channels I see from the helicopter is 270 km, and this is over 300 cubic meters. http://t.co/zl2dfmmk

Dear friends of the National Council of the Socialist Party, this is the last time I speak to you before at least 5 years.
Tomorrow I will be the President of all the French.
I have set a rule: I will not participate in any partisan proceedings in the next 5 years.
The head of state must not be the head of everything.
Experience shows that nothing is possible without the support of a large party.
Before entering the presidency of the Republic, I wanted to show you my loyalty.
Francois Mitterrand had shown, by his tenacity, that a campaign could lead to the culmination of a dream: that of alternation.
The first condition of victory is unity. This time, the unit was at the rendezvous.
The second condition of victory is the passing, the overcoming of divisions.
The third condition of victory is to embody the spirit of the gathering, facing divisions, breaks.
The fourth condition of victory is the will!
Finally, the fifth condition of victory is to climb to the level of France.
It is a heavy responsibility entrusted to me, in a context of exceptional gravity.
If what was waiting for us was not hard, we would not have won the presidential election.
It's because it's difficult for the French to turn to us. For the effort to be right.
The majority must be broad, solid and loyal to support the government, take initiatives and enhance the role of Parliament.
This is the future of the five-year term that will be defined next month.
I will surely miss you, but I must not in any case miss France!

Follow live from the Elysée http://t.co/qNod2k7k the handover.
I give French people a message of hope.
The French gave me a mandate to restore France to justice.
I measure the weight of the constraints facing our country.
There are no fatalities when a common will drives us and we fully mobilize the strengths and assets of France
The first condition of renewed confidence is the unity of the nation.
Our differences should not become divisions, our diversities should not become discords.
The country needs rallying, reconciliation.
I will reaffirm in all circumstances our intangible principle of secularism.
I will fight against racism, anti-Semitism and against all discrimination.
Trust is based on justice.
It's time to put production back before speculation. Sustainable employment before immediate profit.
Justice will be the only criterion on which every decision will be taken in the name of the Republic.
I want to serve a great cause: the gathering. Hope must be the guiding thread. Long live the Republic, long live France!

In front of J. Ferry's statue, I addressed my first words as President to school teachers, researchers and academics.
The school must be assured of its resources, we can not teach properly without adequate supervision for our children.
Today, I reiterate my commitment to recruit 60,000 education staff for the duration of my term.
It is a message of confidence to the National Education that I came to express at the precise moment when I become President of the Republic.
Every example knows limits, all greatness has its weaknesses, and every man is fallible.
In greeting today the memory of J. Ferry, great minister of public education, I know nothing of his political errors.
The defense of colonization by J. Ferry was a moral and political fault. As such, it must be sentenced.

It is an honor to be welcomed on this solemn day here at the Paris City Hall.
Dear Bertrand Delanoë, I have captured your emotion.
This moment is when everyone gets together on the future of the nation.

PM #Netanyahu meets with PM of #Moldova Vlad Filat in Jerusalem. Photo: Amos Ben-Gershom, GPO
Paris has a central role in the recovery of France.
The beautiful must belong to all. Beauty is not a privilege.
Everything that makes Paris progress advances France.
France and Paris have yet to move forward together in the consciousness of a shared destiny.
I address myself to all the French, without ignoring any citizen of the Republic: a new time is opening.
Nothing will be easy, nothing will be given, but nothing is inaccessible to the will.
The challenge of this quinquennium that opens is youth.
The Republic will be to all the French.
The Republic will not leave any of its children aside, but it will not allow any of them to drift.
The state will always be at the rendezvous of the capital. I have only one thing to demand: that Paris be always Paris!
